parts.name: GM '0411' PCM Swap (The LS Holy Grail)
parts.description: The '0411' (Service #12200411) PCM is the gold standard for Gen 3 LS swaps. It has the fastest processor for that era and supports custom operating systems (COS) for boost/nitrous via HP Tuners or EFI Live. It can replace the slower '99-'00 'black box' ECUs in trucks with a pinout swap.
specs: Benefit: Faster processing, Custom OS support

parts.name: Honda OBD1 ECU Chipping (P28 / P72 / P06)
parts.description: Honda OBD1 ECUs are legendary. You can solder a socket into them ('chipping') to run custom tunes (Hondata, Crome, Neptune). The P28 (Civic Si) is the most common VTEC ECU. The P06 (DX) can be converted to VTEC. The P72 (GSR) controls secondary intake runners (IABs).

parts.name: Ford A9L / A9P ECU
parts.description: The A9L (Manual) and A9P (Auto) are the most desirable Foxbody ECUs. They have the most aggressive fuel/timing curves and work best with modifications (heads/cam/intake). Warning: 30+ year old capacitors inside these OFTEN leak and destroy the board.

parts.name: The 'Capacitor Plague' (90s ECU Repair)
parts.description: If your 90s car has weird electrical gremlins, fishy smells, or won't start, check the ECU capacitors. Electrolytic capacitors from this era leak acid onto the circuit board. Replacing them ($5 in parts) can save a $500 ECU.
specs: Symptoms: Fishy smell, No Start, Weird Codes

parts.name: Volvo P2 CEM Overheating Fix
parts.description: The Central Electronic Module (CEM) on P2 Volvos overheats, causing complete electrical chaos (gauges die, wipers go crazy, car stalls). The fix is to send it to Xemodex for a rebuild with better heat sinks, or rig up a PC fan to blow on it.

parts.name: Land Rover Discovery 2 'Three Amigos' Fix
parts.description: The 'Three Amigos' are the TC, HDC, and ABS lights. This is usually caused by the ABS Modulator Shuttle Valve Switch failing ($50 part) or a bad solder joint in the ABS ECU. You can bypass the internal switch wiring to fix it permanently.
specs: Cause: Shuttle Valve Switch / Solder Joints

parts.name: BMW EWS Delete (Immobilizer)
parts.description: BMW's EWS immobilizer prevents engine swaps. For M50/M52/S50/S52/M54 swaps, you must delete EWS from the DME (ECU). This is done via software flash (MS41/MS42/MS43 tuning) or an emulator chip.

parts.name: VW / Audi Immobilizer Defeat (Immo 2/3)
parts.description: You cannot just swap an ECU in these cars; the Immobilizer will shut off the engine after 2 seconds. You must either clone the EEPROM, pair the cluster/keys, or flash an 'Immo Off' file to the ECU.

parts.name: Nissan Nistune / Daughterboard
parts.description: Nissan ECUs from the 90s can be modified with a 'daughterboard' (Nistune) that allows real-time tuning via USB, just like a standalone ECU, but retaining factory driveability and sensors.

parts.name: Cobb Accessport (Subaru)
parts.description: The standard for Subaru tuning. It plugs into the OBD2 port and allows you to flash 'Off The Shelf' (OTS) maps for common modifications (Stage 1, Stage 2) or get a custom 'Pro Tune'.
specs: Features: Datalogging, Launch Control, Flat Foot Shift

parts.name: Chrysler SBEC / JTEC ECU Repair
parts.description: Older Jeep and Dodge ECUs (SBEC/JTEC) are potted in a rubbery gel. The capacitors fail, or solder joints crack on the connector pins. You have to carefully dig out the potting compound to repair them.
specs: Issue: Cracked Solder Joints / Bad Caps
